verses.text: 問安耶穌基督的使徒彼得，寫信給那分散在本都、加拉太、加帕多家、亞西亞、庇推尼寄居的人，

words.note: Often refers to temporary residence in a foreign land.

verses.text: 就是照著父　神的預知蒙揀選，藉著聖靈得成聖潔，因而順服，並且被耶穌基督的血灑過的人。願恩惠平安多多地加給你們。

words.note: Refers to God the Father.
Often implies a passive or favorable reception.
Means 'to be made' or 'to achieve the state of'.

verses.text: 信心經過考驗比金子更寶貴我們主耶穌基督的父　神是應當稱頌的。他照著自己的大憐憫，藉著耶穌基督從死人中復活，重生了我們，使我們有永活的盼望，

words.note: A title for God or Jesus Christ.
Refers to God the Father.
Here makes '稱頌' a descriptive phrase, 'worthy of praise'.
Often used as a suffix for 'among' or 'in the midst of'.

verses.text: 可以得著不能朽壞、不能玷污、不能衰殘，為你們存留在天上的基業，
就是你們這因信蒙　神能力保守的人，得著預備在末世要顯現的救恩。

words.note: Often implies a passive or favorable reception.

verses.text: 因此，你們要喜樂。然而，你們現今在各種試煉中或許暫時會難過，

words.note: Commonly used in Christian contexts for spiritual joy.
Lit. 'testing and refining'. Often refers to spiritual trials.
Lit. 'hard to pass through'.

verses.text: 是要叫你們的信心經過試驗，就比那被火煉過，仍會朽壞的金子更寶貴，可以在耶穌基督顯現的時候，得著稱讚、榮耀和尊貴。

words.note: Refers to purifying metals by heat.
Used for organic and material decay.
Often used for divine appearance.
Common in biblical Chinese, less common in modern spoken language.
Often used for divine glory or human honor.

verses.text: 你們雖然沒有見過他，卻愛他；現在雖然不能看見他，卻信他。因此，你們就有無法形容、滿有榮耀的大喜樂，

words.note: A common construct in biblical Chinese.

verses.text: 得到你們信心的效果，就是靈魂得救。
論到這救恩，那預言你們要得恩典的眾先知，都尋求考察過，

words.note: Classical Chinese term, common in biblical texts for 'all the'.
Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.

verses.text: 就是把他們心裡基督的靈所預先見證，關於基督要受苦難後來得榮耀，是在甚麼時候和怎樣的情況加以考察。
他們蒙了啟示，為這些事效力，並不是為自己，而是為你們。現在，藉著傳福音給你們的人，靠著從天上差來的聖靈，把這些事傳給了你們；甚至天使也很想詳細察看這些事。

words.note: Often used for receiving grace or favor in a religious context.

words.definition: it is not that, not at all

verses.text: 你們要聖潔所以要準備好你們的心，警醒謹慎，專心盼望耶穌基督顯現的時候所要帶給你們的恩典。
你們既是順服的兒女，就不要再效法從前無知的時候放縱私慾的生活。
那召你們的既是聖潔的，你們在一切所行的事上也要聖潔。

words.note: Refers to one's actions or behavior.

verses.text: 因為聖經上記著說：「你們要聖潔，因為我是聖潔的。」

words.note: Lit. 'holy scripture'.
Indicates location within a text.
Marks an adjective or an attributive.

verses.text: 你們既稱那不偏待人、按各人行為審判的主為父，就當存敬畏的心，過你們寄居的日子；

words.note: Indicates a premise or given fact.
Describes God's attribute of fairness.
Marks an attributive modifying 'Lord'.
Here, meaning 'to be considered as' or 'to take as'.
Indicates a consequence or result.
To keep or maintain (a certain state of mind).
Marks an attributive modifying 'heart'.
To experience or live through time.
Often used for temporary residence in a foreign land.
Marks an attributive modifying 'days'.

verses.text: 因為知道你們得贖，脫去你們祖先傳下的妄行，不是憑著能壞的金銀等物，

words.note: Marks an attributive modifying 'futile conduct'.
Marks an attributive modifying 'gold and silver'.

verses.text: 而是憑著基督的寶血，就像無瑕疵無玷污的羊羔的血。

words.note: Often used with '是' to indicate contrast.
Here, emphasizes the comparison 'just like'.
Marks an attributive modifying 'lamb'.

verses.text: 基督是在創立世界以前，是　神所預知的，卻在這末後的世代才為你們顯現出來。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional reverence marker in some Chinese Bibles.
Forms a passive construction, similar to 'that which'.
Marks the end of an attributive phrase or verbal phrase acting as a noun.
Indicates a contrast or unexpected turn.
Marks an attributive modifying 'generation'.
Emphasizes that something happened only under specific conditions or at a late time.
A verb phrase indicating revelation or manifestation.

verses.text: 藉著他，你們信那使他從死人中復活、又給他榮耀的　神，叫你們的信心和盼望都在於　神。

words.note: Refers to resurrection from the dead.
Often refers to divine glory.
The space before 神 (Shén) is a reverential convention in some Bibles.
Lit. 'believing heart'.
Biblically, hope often implies expectation.
The space before 神 (Shén) is a reverential convention in some Bibles.

verses.text: 主的道永遠長存你們既因順從真理，潔淨了自己的心靈，以致能真誠地愛弟兄，就應當從清潔的心裡彼此切實相愛。

words.note: Refers to Jesus Christ.
In a biblical context, often refers to God's Word/message.
Often used in a spiritual or ceremonial sense.
Refers to the inner being or spiritual essence.

words.definition: so that, with the result that

words.note: Can refer to male siblings or fellow believers.

verses.text: 你們得了重生，並不是由於能壞的種子，卻是由於不能朽壞的，就是藉著　神永活長存的道。

words.note: Refers to spiritual rebirth.
Often used in contrast to earthly perishability.
Here makes '不能朽壞' (that which cannot perish) into a noun phrase.
The space before 神 (Shén) is a reverential convention in some Bibles.
In a biblical context, often refers to God's Word/message.

verses.text: 因為「所有的人（「人」原文作「肉體」），盡都如草，他們的榮美，都像草上的花；草必枯乾，花必凋謝，

words.note: In biblical context, refers to human nature/mortality.

verses.text: 唯有主的道，永遠長存。」所傳給你們的福音就是這道。

words.note: Refers to Jesus Christ.
In a biblical context, often refers to God's Word/message.
Forms a passive construction, 'that which is preached'.
Lit. 'blessed news'.
In a biblical context, often refers to God's Word/message.
